snippet: The president of the California Fish and Game Commission legally shot a mountain lion in Idaho in January. A picture of him, grinning, with its body was published a couple of weeks later. The subsequent outcry may say more about a cultural shift in...
abstract: The president of the California Fish and Game Commission legally shot a mountain lion in Idaho in January. A picture of him, grinning, with its body was published a couple of weeks later. The subsequent outcry may say more about a cultural shift in the state than the incident itself.

headline.main: In California, Open Season on Trophy Hunting
